intro: Casearia contermina, commonly known as the white casearia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Salicaceae family, which includes willows and poplars, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are clustered in catkins, typical of the family. Its fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that dehisces to release seeds. Casearia contermina is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
